text:
The force of the solid concrete resonated through Damon's body. His shirt was soaked with sweat and his hair was matted with wetness. The blaring guitars and the amplifier which came up to his shoulders still amazed him, despite his now 8-year career. He scrambled to his feet to sing the final verse of his song- "Hey, this is the music! Moving on, we're moving on!" 
	The club was very small, about the size of a large classroom. It was a rare occurrence in the popular band's life to be able to play a venue so small and personal, usually they were resigned to huge stadium shows and television performances.
